intro: Boechera suffrutescens, commonly known as rockcress, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This low-growing perennial has small, basal leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Boechera suffrutescens is notable for its ability to survive in harsh, cold climates and is sometimes used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
